channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Women experience hair loss too. Here's what can help
item.description: Getting a diagnosis is key since there are different causes for the problem calling for different treatments. Here's what to know and how to find supp...

item.title: In DR Congo, exhibit reveals nostalgia for former dictator Mobutu
item.description: Nostalgia is rising in Congo for Mobutu Sese Seko — the kleptocratic strongman as a new museum exhibit glorifying him draws crowds in Kinshasa.

item.title: G20 summit closes in South Africa after U.S. absence
item.description: The G20 closed in Johannesburg without a ceremonial hand over to the U.S., its next chair, after Washington boycotted the summit.

item.title: 50 schoolchildren escape captivity in Nigeria, more than 200 still held
item.description: Fifty of the 303 schoolchildren abducted from a Catholic school in Nigeria's Niger state have escaped and are now with their families.

item.title: Israel says it killed a senior Hezbollah official in first strike on Beirut in months
item.description: An Israeli airstrike has struck Beirut for the first time since June.

item.title: Ukraine's Aonishiki becomes sumo champion in Japan
item.description: Aonishiki wins the November sumo tournament in Japan and becomes the first person from Ukraine to claim an elite-level sumo championship.

item.title: Ukraine meets with Western allies in Geneva to discuss U.S.-proposed peace plan
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio described the first session of high-stakes talks in Geneva as "probably the most productive and meaningful meeting" sin...

item.title: Mamdani stands by Trump criticism despite friendly White House meeting
Kelly says Trump should understand his words could have "serious consequences"
item.description: Sen. Mark Kelly criticized President Trump for his recent comments accusing a group of Democratic lawmakers of "seditious behavior."

item.title: Aftermath of Chicago’s intense immigration crackdown leaves lawsuits, investigations and anxiety
item.description: Chicago has entered what many consider an uneasy phase of a Trump administration immigration crackdown that has already led to thousands of arrests. W...

item.title: Israel kills top Hezbollah official in first attack on Beirut in months
item.description: Israel has escalated its campaign on targets it says are linked to Hezbollah, raising fears of a resumption of hostilities.

item.title: Seven arrested in India after police crack $800,000 bank heist
item.description: Armed men posing as bank officials robbed a van transporting cash between bank branches in Bengaluru city.

item.title: G20 summit boycotted by US closes in South Africa
item.description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa says there is a "renewed commitment to multilateral co-operation".

item.title: Transcript: Olga Stefanishyna, Ukrainian Ambassador to the U.S., on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," Nov. 23, 2025
item.description: The following is the transcript of the interview with Olga Stefanishyna, Ukrainian Ambassador to the U.S., that aired on "Face the Nation with Margare...

item.title: Full transcript of "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," Nov. 23, 2025
item.description: On this "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" broadcast, Sens. Mark Kelly and Rand Paul join Margaret Brennan.

item.title: U.S., Ukrainian officials discussing bringing Zelenskyy to U.S., sources say
item.description: The proposed trip is part of President Trump's push to get an agreement on Ukraine by Thanksgiving, U.S. and Ukrainian officials said.

item.title: Fifty children escape after mass school abduction in Nigeria
item.description: The raid on a Christian school came amid a surge of attacks by armed groups in the African nation.

item.title: UAB football player accused of stabbing 2 teammates before game
